positive.review: I still maintain that this is one of the best C&C titles ever released and would sell a kidney just to get a proper remaster.

BUILDING, UNABLE TO COMPLY BUILDING IN PROGRESS, CONSTRUCTION COMPLETE NEW CONSTRUCTION OPTIONS

TRAINING, UNIT READY, UNIT READY, UNIT READY, UNIT READY, UNIT READY, UNIT READY, UNIT READY, UNIT READY, UNIT READY, UNIT READY, UNIT READY, UNIT READY, UNIT READY, UNIT READY, UNIT READY

It‚Äôs one of the greatest strategy games ever made. I used to play single-player skirmishes for years after its release. About a year ago, I mentioned it to a friend who also used to play it, so we decided to try the multiplayer mode together. I was surprised to see how active the servers still are - 25 years after its release.

It‚Äôs easy to learn and master, with no ads, no waiting, and fast-paced war simulation matches that give you clear results within just 15‚Äì30 minutes of gameplay.

Today, a unit has been lost, not just a unit, a voice and character who is in the childhoods of many.
"The entire world, and all of its history, is mine to COMMAND AND CONQUER." - Yuri
Rest in Peace Udo Kier, the actor who played Yuri.
1944 - 2025

The greatest RTS of all time. I know that is subjective but it has a great story. Great units, memorable gameplay that stands the test of time. Even with the online play. Will always go back and play this on a regular basis.
For me it's THE ref in the RA series, but each one is entitled to their favorite, of course. Love the Allies campaign, but the Soviet one is great too.
Literally one of the greatest games ever made next to Elder Scrolls 3 Morrowind
One of my favourite games, i started playing at the age of 4 and been playing since then, i recently managed to buy it on steam and can't wait to play more ‚ù§Ô∏è
I'm a big fan of this game; I used to play it back in 1998, but unfortunately it hasn't evolved and is still on the same maps.
this is the best of the best of C&C, when westwood was firering on all cylinders. this is a dam good rts great FMV.

x-- 9/10 --x

What a blast. Absolutely loved this game in the series

I first played this awesome game on my dad's PC and I fell more in love with the franchise as I played the first and second games from westwood on my PS1 and it has great acting from the amazing cast and the graphics are still good today and it is what makes command and conquer the best games of all time.
Great, but I can't buy it as a gift as the oligarchs who own everything seem to think that gifts are Communism or something.
Excellent game, definitely a blast of nostalgia for me, my particular favorite aspect was the veteran aspect for units, as well as the hilarious cutscenes.

Oh god the controls are so clunky. It's no Brood War

Cool game though. Genuinely, the units and gameplay is good, weird ass controls aside

Wish I could fucking play it without bashing my head against 25 years of muscle memory.

And if you ask about it online, people will call you a retarded idiot for wanting controls more in line with almost LITERALLY EVERY OTHER RTS EVER MADE. Like wow, y'all think the control scheme here are good? I mean, okay... I STRONGLY disagree, but ya know I didn't grow up with it. 

If anyone has any good UI mods to make this playable, lmk

Again, pretty cool game though. I inquired as to why this one is the most popular, and unit balance seems to be a big part of it, and, yeah that seems to ring true. I played through the GDI campaign of C&C 3 and yeah, that game was way less balanced. So if you aren't bothered by it having wildly different controls to the vast majority of RTS games, deeeefinitely check it out. It's one of the good ones.
I've been playing this for years, since it came out back before Windows Vista! It never gets old, unlike myself.

Played without issues. Many crazy units, an interesting take on a RTS. Worth the time and the money. Campaigns plus DLC took me 25 hours with mostly noobish play. Beware of difficulty spikes. There are guides for most missions.
It requires forethought and tactics. Love the challenge!
still epic fun but multiplayer unaveable

üïäÔ∏èUdo Kier  [1944-2025] 
Rip to the one of the greatest German actors of our time...
I have completed Allied and Soviet Stories... But there isnt ant Yuri's Revenge Indicator.. How do i Play Yuri's Revenge?
Probably the most finely balanced RTS game of all time. Still hold up incredibly well.
The bots alone will provide significant enough challenge for you if you don't know what you are doing.
I am not sure for this game that was Childhood game or not.
All the features of the nostalgic game are contained
This is the Greatest C&C game of All time great story great characters and a Great and fun gameplay loop. And Yuri (Rip) was and will always be one of the Goats of C&C Characters of all time.
red alert 2 does not need any introduction or explanation on why it is the best....

A reminis from the past. This game is quite a gold standard. Over 25 year old but still holds you on your toes. One of the better stragery game i have played.
recommended

My very 1st video game experience. Bought the C&C collection just to relive my nostalgic days.

PS: For better offline / online experience, install CnCNet Client. The launcher comes with a lot of community made mappacks and game modes for single player.
its a class act in old school rts ....no phone game is like it ,,,, Always go for the original

Please ignore time played. I have played it all the way through multiple times just never on this platform. I played it briefly to test and it ran smoothly and all I had to do was get CNC draw
Pros: Without a doubt the best of the franchise up to the point that it was released from the perspective of the best tactical opportunities. If you can arrange multiplayer then it's Thrilling. Basically every single ability or attack has a counter regardless of who you're playing as or against, a first for command and conquer. Udo Kier Is incredibly charismatic here. In some ways feels like the first red alert on steroids which is mostly a good thing. They finally give useful super weapons to the allied forces. Some of the best cutscenes up to this point especially intro wise. Playing as or against Yuri himself can get trippy. Yuri's revenge has some creative and fun levels including one where you go through Hollywood and can recruit Schwarzenegger Clint Eastwood and others. The Spy is unbelievably useful.
Cons: Getting past the cheesy tone is necessary if you want to play the campaign modes but it takes more than a little getting used to that they're now purposefully going there instead of accidentally ending up there. While thankfully it is remedied in generals which was the very next one of these It is pretty ridiculous to release and RTS in 2001 that still does not for example let you do attack move when that has been in Starcraft One since 1998.
strongly recommended for long time fans Or people already used to what real time strategy looked like back when these came out, mildly recommended for people who love RTS
my favourite pc game from my child hood a great rts game
fun and challenging. and i personally would like to see a remaster.
This is where Westwood really started to cook with C&C. One of my favorites in the series.
For a game thats 25 years old, this game knew the world was coming to an end.

GI: WAT!?

as fun to play as the day it was released

Still an incredible game after all these years

classic but still fun
sometimes i can't believe i still play this game ,i miss the old time when rts games were good
The best game of my life, ever and forever.
Rubber boots in motion.
I love this game. Resolution should be higher.
Can't go wrong with this classic.

1944 - 2025

Do I like one of the best RTS games ever made? This game defined my teens, and really, any review I would write would be drenched in nostalgia unlike no other. 
Obviously, it has its flaws, I mean, the game's over 25 years old. A lot of quality-of-life and common practice RTS controls, AI and features were just not invented or perfected yet. The controls can be janky and the units dumb as rocks. I can even imagine the slight *click* after every voice line can be grating after listening to it for hours on end (if you never noticed that, I'm sorry, I might have ruined the game for you).
But nothing can beat the campy theme, music, and timeless gameplay.
Is it done? No comrade, it has only begun.
Must Play!! Will be the first game and last game i ever play.... Im 31

It‚Äôs one of the greatest strategy games ever made. I used to play single-player skirmishes for years after its release. About a year ago, I mentioned it to a friend who also used to play it, so we decided to try the multiplayer mode together. I was surprised to see how active the servers still are - 25 years after its release.

It‚Äôs easy to learn and master, with no ads, no waiting, and fast-paced war simulation matches that give you clear results within just 15‚Äì30 minutes of gameplay.

Some quirks with windows 11 in that I can NOT quit the game through the menu or it will make my computer unusable until a hard restart. 

That said, once you realize you're dealing with 2001 software, you got a solid and addictive game that can be enjoyed casually for decades.
Literally one of the greatest games ever made next to Elder Scrolls 3 Morrowind

Steam Deck Review (Yuri‚Äôs Revenge Edition)

Pros:
- Nostalgic fun‚Äîlike time-traveling straight back to the early 2000s.
- Yuri‚Äôs Revenge still hits with the same charm and chaos.

Cons:

- Even on lowest settings, skirmish lags harder than a traffic jam at rush hour.
- Accidentally reminded me of dial-up internet. I swear I heard the eeee-errr-khhhhh sound in my head.

Verdict:
Great trip down memory lane, but I didn‚Äôt sign up for 2001 lag speeds. Someone please patch me back into broadband. Thank you.
